CodeSchool
http://campus.codeschool.com/courses/shaping-up-with-angular-js/level/1/section/1/video/1

Directives:
- marker on html tag, tells Angluar to run or reference some js:
  <html ng-app="appName"> <!-- appName will match name of app from module declaration -->
  <body ng-controller="mainControllerFunctionName">
  <button ng-show="store.product.canPurchase">Add to Cart</button>

Modules: 
- pieces of encapsulated js, also where we define dependencies
  var app = angular.module( 'appName', [ ] ); // empty array for now, but will be array of dependencies

Expressions: 
- {{ 4 + 6 }}
- {{ 'Hello' + ' ' + 'World!' }}

Controllers:
- define functions and behaviors, help us get js onto the page
- wrap controllers in closures
